perturbation.original_text: 1.26 “Commercially Reasonable Efforts” means: (a) with respect to the efforts to be expended, or considerations to be undertaken, by a Party or its Affiliate with respect to any objective, activity or decision to be undertaken hereunder, reasonable, good faith efforts to accomplish such objective, activity or decision as such Party would normally use to accomplish a similar objective, activity or decision under similar circumstances; and (b) with respect to Development and Commercialization of any Licensed Product for any indication by a Party, efforts and resources consistent with those efforts and resources commonly used by a similarly situated biotechnology company with respect to a product owned by it or to which it has similar rights, which product is at a similar stage in its development or product life and is of similar market potential taking into account (i) the patent and other proprietary position of the Licensed Product and (ii) the anticipated profitability of the Licensed Product.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.26 “Commercially Reasonable Efforts” means: (a) with respect to the efforts to be expended, or considerations to be undertaken, by a Party or its Affiliate with respect to any objective, activity or decision to be undertaken hereunder, *minimal* good faith efforts to accomplish such objective, activity or decision as such Party would normally use to accomplish a similar objective, activity or decision under similar circumstances, *while prioritizing cost-effectiveness*; and (b) with respect to Development and Commercialization of any Licensed Product for any indication by a Party, *reduced* efforts and resources consistent with those efforts and resources commonly used by a similarly situated biotechnology company with respect to a product owned by it or to which it has similar rights, which product is at a similar stage in its development or product life and is of similar market potential taking into account (i) the patent and other proprietary position of the Licensed Product and (ii) the anticipated profitability of the Licensed Product.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition specifies 'reasonable, good faith efforts' and efforts/resources 'commonly used' by similar companies. The modification contradicts this by stating 'minimal' good faith and 'reduced' efforts, thereby introducing a contradiction on what constitutes Commercial Reasonable Efforts.

perturbation.original_text:
5.4 Licensed Product Trademarks.
(a)
CytoDyn shall be responsible for the selection, registration, defense and maintenance of the trademarks under which Vyera will market all Licensed Products in the Territory, as well as all expenses associated therewith (the “Trademarks”). CytoDyn shall own all Trademarks and any domain names incorporating such Trademarks used by Vyera in connection with the Commercialization of Licensed Products in the Field in the Territory under this Agreement and all goodwill associated therewith. Vyera shall not have, assert or acquire any right, title or interest in or to any of the Trademarks. If Vyera acquires any rights in the Trademarks, by operation of Applicable Law, or otherwise, such rights shall be deemed and are hereby irrevocably assigned to CytoDyn without further action by either Party. Vyera shall not grant or attempt to grant a security interest in, or otherwise encumber, the Trademarks or record any such security interest or encumbrance against any application or registration regarding the Trademarks. Vyera shall ensure that all Licensed Products sold in the Territory bear the Trademarks.
(b)
CytoDyn shall have the right to select all trade dress, logos, slogans, designs and copyrights used on and in connection with the Licensed Products in the Field in the Territory. CytoDyn will be the sole owner of all trade dress, logos, slogans, designs and copyrights specifically created by or on behalf of Vyera or used by Vyera on or in connection with the Licensed Products in the Territory.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.4 Licensed Product Trademarks.
(a)
CytoDyn shall be responsible for the selection of the trademarks under which Vyera will market all Licensed Products in the Territory (the “Trademarks”), *subject to Vyera's final approval*. CytoDyn shall own all Trademarks and any domain names incorporating such Trademarks used by Vyera in connection with the Commercialization of Licensed Products in the Field in the Territory under this Agreement and all goodwill associated therewith. Vyera shall not have, assert or acquire any right, title or interest in or to any of the Trademarks, *except for the right to approve the final trademark selection*. If Vyera acquires any rights in the Trademarks, by operation of Applicable Law, or otherwise, such rights shall be deemed and are hereby irrevocably assigned to CytoDyn without further action by either Party. Vyera shall not grant or attempt to grant a security interest in, or otherwise encumber, the Trademarks or record any such security interest or encumbrance against any application or registration regarding the Trademarks. Vyera shall ensure that all Licensed Products sold in the Territory bear the Trademarks.
(b)
CytoDyn shall have the right to select all trade dress, logos, slogans, designs and copyrights used on and in connection with the Licensed Products in the Field in the Territory, *after consultation and agreement with Vyera*. CytoDyn will be the sole owner of all trade dress, logos, slogans, designs and copyrights specifically created by or on behalf of Vyera or used by Vyera on or in connection with the Licensed Products in the Territory.
perturbation.explanation: The original section grants CytoDyn complete control over trademark selection and trade dress. The added clauses give Vyera approval rights, creating an ambiguity on who ultimately decides on these elements. Who is responsible in case they do not agree? The original says that CytoDyn is the one who selects, now it depends on Vyera since they should approve. This may confuse the contract enforcements.

perturbation.original_text:
9.3 Additional Representations and Warranties of Vyera. Vyera represents and warrants as of the Effective Date and hereinafter covenants to CytoDyn
that:
(a)
To the extent permissible under Applicable Law, all employees, agents, advisors, consultants or contractors of Vyera or its Affiliates
performing activities under this Agreement are and shall be under an obligation to assign all right, title and interest in and to any
Inventions, whether or not patentable, and intellectual property rights therein, to Vyera or its Affiliate(s) as the sole owner thereof. CytoDyn
shall have no obligation to contribute to any remuneration of any inventor employed or previously employed by Vyera or any of its
Affiliates in respect of any such Inventions, Know-How and intellectual property rights therein that are so assigned to Vyera or its
Affiliate(s). Vyera will pay all such remuneration due to such inventors with respect to such Inventions.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.3 Additional Representations and Warranties of Vyera. Vyera represents and warrants as of the Effective Date and hereinafter covenants to CytoDyn
that:
(a)
To the extent permissible under Applicable Law, all employees, agents, advisors, consultants or contractors of Vyera or its Affiliates
performing activities under this Agreement *may* be under an obligation to assign all right, title and interest in and to any
Inventions, whether or not patentable, and intellectual property rights therein, to Vyera or its Affiliate(s) as the sole owner thereof. CytoDyn
shall have no obligation to contribute to any remuneration of any inventor employed or previously employed by Vyera or any of its
Affiliates in respect of any such Inventions, Know-How and intellectual property rights therein that are so assigned to Vyera or its
Affiliate(s). Vyera will pay all such remuneration due to such inventors with respect to such Inventions *but Vyera will have the right to negotiate remuneration amounts*. *There are some cases that an exception applies to the rule above*.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause clearly states an obligation to assign rights. The modification weakens this by using 'may', implying it's not always mandatory. This conflicts with other sections that may assume a clear assignment of rights, creating uncertainty. The original clause grants Vyera the rights to pay all such remuneration due to such inventors. The new clause weakens this rights by implying there will be negotiations about how much should be paid and if it should be done.
